N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 ยง 2.32 - Lighting and ventilation-item 4p

State Regulations
(a) Adequate lighting in hand-washing areas, dressing and locker rooms, toilet rooms, and all areas where food is
manufactured, processed, packed, or held, and where equipment or utensils are
cleaned, shall be provided. (b) Adequate ventilation or control equipment to minimize dust, odors, and vapors
(including steam and noxious fumes) in areas where they may cause allergen
cross-contact or contaminate food shall be provided; fans and other air-blowing
equipment shall be provided, located, and operated in a manner that minimizes
the potential for allergen cross-contact and for contaminating food, food-packaging materials, and food-contact surfaces. (c) Ventilation in all rooms is sufficient to
keep them reasonably free of odors and excessive condensation on equipment, walls and ceilings. (d) Pressurized
ventilating systems, if used, have a filtered air intake. Notes
